revised_title: Hudson Bay Quadrupeds: Descriptions and Observations
tldr: The article provides detailed descriptions and observations of various quadrupeds found in Hudson Bay, including their habitats, behaviors, and uses. It also discusses the fur trade and the impact of migration on the populations of these animals. The author, John Reinhold Forster, describes the white fox, the yellow-breasted marten, and the American hare, among others, and highlights their unique characteristics and adaptations to the cold climate.
